text: Daniel Olivares Viniegra (born 1961) is a Mexican writer and poet. He is a member of the editorial committee of the magazine El Comité 1973 and member of the literary group El Comité. Olivares won the third international award Poesía Navachiste 1995. == Biography == Olivares was born in Tehuetlán, Hidalgo. He has a Master in Iberoamerican literature at the National Autonomous University of Mexico. He also studied literature at the National Autonomous University of Mexico. Olivares is married with the visual artist Elsa Madrigal. He has published several books of poetry and he also has published articles, essays and poems in different magazine, like Humo Sólido and La Piraña, across Latin America. == Selected work == Sartal del tiempo. México: Praxis. 1992. . Arenas. México: Universidad Autónoma de Sinaloa (col. Hipocampos). 1996. . Atar(de)sol. México: Cisnegro. 2016. Antiparras: Antipoemas para lectores sin prejuicios. México: Trajín. 2017. . == El Comité == Olivares was invited by Meneses Monroy to collaborate with the literary group El Comité in 2014. In 2017 the group celebrated its fifth anniversary in the Centro Cultural del México Contemporáneo. His wife Elsa Madrigal is also a member of the group. == References == Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:People from Hidalgo (state) Category:Mexican poets Category:Mexican essayists
